summary:
The Coca-Cola Company, an American multinational, makes and sells soft drinks like Coca-Cola. Founded in 1892, it began as a "healthy tonic" created by John Pemberton in 1886, containing cocaine and caffeine. The name comes from the coca and kola plants.

Asa Candler bought the recipe in 1889 and formed the company in Atlanta. They make syrup concentrate, which is then bottled and distributed worldwide through an exclusive franchise system. Coca-Cola's stock is traded on the New York Stock Exchange and is part of major US stock indexes.
title: The Coca-Cola Company
